title: Peter Pan (singer)
content:
Pan Yuwen (traditional Chinese: 潘裕文; born June 20, 1984) is a Taiwanese pop singer.

He has participated in singing competition shows such as One Million Star and Super Star.

In 2007, he participated in the first season of One Million Star, a singing competition show on CTV.[1]

The media dubbed him, Yoga Lin, Zhou Dingwei, and Xu Renjie, all of whom were signed to HIM, as "Starlight Four".[2]

In 2008, in addition to domestic singing activities, he also held concerts with other Starlight participants in Hong Kong, Singapore, and Malaysia.[3][4] In June and July, he held a personal mini concert in Taichung and Taipei. Pan challenged himself by singing songs of different styles, such as Peter & Mary by Mayday and Black Tangerine by David Tao. On October 24, 2008, his first personal EP Summer Rain Poem was released.[5]

On August 7, 2010, Pan won an award at the Metro Radio Mandarin Hits Music Awards was held in Hong Kong.[6]

In June 2011, he participated in the Information Office-funded film and television programs - "A-Ming Shore Fishing", as the protagonist A-Ming.[7]

On October 26, 2012, his second album Listen to clock was officially released.[8]

On December 3, 2013, his digital single Thirst was released.[9] This song is earned from his participation on the show Super Star I Want to Be a Singer after he lasted 11 rounds.[10]

In June 2010, he was selected by the Taoyuan City Government as the spokesperson for the “Taoyuan Upgrade to Municipality Become a Dreamer” event. At the 2010 Shanghai World Expo, he served as the spokesperson for the UITP Pavilion of the International Federation of Public Transport.[11]
